comments:
Using "fresh" build I20051214-0010.

I upgraded this morning with last I-Build and was updating my workspace.
I've launched a synchronization on JDT/Core projects and wanted to replace JDT/UI ones. When I opened Team->Replace with... menu item, eclipse suddenly left the session and save the workspace.

In .log there was following exception:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 2005-12-14 09:14:03.889

!MESSAGE java.lang.StackOverflowError

java.lang.StackOverflowError

I restarted eclipse and redo same scenario and everything was fine...

The StackOverflowError does not come from SWT but from code that was running in an asynchronous runnable.

Do you have the stack traceback for the StackOverflowError?  It should have been reported in the log in addition to the stack trace you have already included in this bug report.

Unfortunately, this stack trace was all I had in .log file...
Feel free to close as remind, I'll reopen it with more information if possible next time this problem occurs.
We never use the REMIND state.  I will close this as invalid.  Please reopen if you have the error again and include the error for the cause of the stack overflow.
